content.text: Use imperative verbs when you’re telling or inviting users to do something. Imperative verbs are clear and brisk. They don’t need a subject, which saves at least one word.

Previously in Ixiasoft, our practice was to use a gerund as the first word in a task topic title. Gerunds are nouns that functions as verbs, like “creating” in “creating an environment.” We have discontinued that practice. Begin the title of a task topic in Ixiasoft, or the title of any procedure no matter the tool, with an imperative verb as in “create an environment.”
